results.title: Samson et Dalila
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Covent Garden Video Productions, Elijah Moshinsky and John Vernon
results.brief_description: Camille Saint-Saens’ opera Samson et Dalila in three acts with libretto by Ferdinand Lemaire recorded live for television at the Royal Opera House, Covent Garden. Based on Chapter 16 of the Book of Judges, this is the story of Samson (John Vickers), hero of the Israelites, and his betrayal by Dalila (Shirley Verrett). Features the Royal Opera Chorus and Orchestra of the Royal Opera House conducted by Sir Colin Davis, choreography by David Bintley and scenery and costume designed by Sidney Nolan. Cast also includes Jonathan Summers, Gwynne Howell, John Tomlinson, Maldwyn Davies, Matthew Best, John Dobson. Sung in French.

results.title: Samson and Sally [Widescreen]
results.brief_description: This fully animated film is a warm, funny and gripping adventure about two young whales, Samson and Sally. Sally is accepted into Samson’s herd after her mother gets killed by whalers. The two young whales become great friends and we follow their exciting journeys in the magic world of the ocean. Their lives are not without danger as they encounter whalers and the dumping of radioactive waste.

results.title: Samson and Delilah
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures and Cecil B. DeMille
results.brief_description: Cecil B. De Mille’s famous epic style is highlighted in this classic bible story about the legendary strongman Samson and the temptress Delilah, who helped destroy him. Lauded for its lush cinematography, performances, costumes, sets and special effects, it was a box office smash.

constellations_other.name: Religion, cinema and censorship
constellations_other.description: Religious narratives and themes have a complicated relationship with censorship, with creators pushing the boundaries for better or worse.

results.description: Cecil B. De Mille’s famous epic style is highlighted in this classic Bible story about the legendary strongman Samson, and the temptress Delilah, who seduced, betrayed and helped to destroy him. Victor Mature is the classic Samson; strong, brave and fearless as he wrestles lions and Philistines bare-handed. Hedy Lamarr is stunning as Delilah; in an array of dazzling and seductive costumes. Action packed, this Biblical epic is a spectacle to enjoy. Also stars George Sanders and Angela Lansbury.

results.title: Samsara
results.creator_credit: Fandango, Ocean Films, Pandora Films, Paradis Films, Karl Baumgartner, Christoph Friedel and Pan Nalin
results.brief_description: A young Buddhist returns from three years of meditative solitude, to the monastery where he grew up. As his fellow monks gently reawaken Tashi to the physical world, he simultaneously experiences physical arousal and an interest in women. Despite the efforts of his master to dissuade him, Tashi feels he must encounter the real world in order to renounce it. Hence begins Tashi’s journey of sex, marriage, and industry among a remote mountain community. Set in Ladakh, in the Himalayas, “Samsara” is spectacularly beautiful whilst also successfully conveying the trials of life for this village. Tashi - although enjoying the bliss of sex and pleasure of marriage - is ill-prepared for the conflicts of life as an ordinary man. Christy Chung, playing Tashi’s wife, provides a grounded perspective of what spirituality truly means in everyday life.

results.title: Sample people
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation, Living Motion Pictures, Emile Sherman, Barton Smith and Clinton Smith
results.brief_description: Phil’s falafel shop is where it all goes down - some peoples’ lives culminate in a single defining moment and how they all get to that point over a forty-eight hour period is the storyline. Set in 1990s Sydney, the drug and techno music lifestyle of a group of young men and women is explored. DJ Lush Puppy (Nathalie Roy), the good-looking girl DJ and skateboard rider, is friend of Jess (Kylie Minogue) who is working in the sleazy underworld crime scene. Jess and her beau (Simon Lyndon) aim to make off with some cash, leaving the gangster lifestyle behind. Homeboy Joey and his mate Gus have a gun and not much to occupy their time except to be wild and crazy out on the streets. Sam (Joel Edgerton) has a premonition that his girlfriend is going to overdose and wants to get out of town on a holiday. Nightclubbing, sex and hallucinogenic trips send the friends into a spin and pursuit by the upset gangsters sets up some tension - all leading them to Phil’s Falafels where an armed robbery and death occur. Some lighter moments and one-liners aim to relieve the tense atmosphere, as does the rock/techno soundtrack. Cast includes: Ben Mendelsohn, David Field, Paula Arundell, Justin Rosniak, Matthew Wilkinson, Gandhi MacIntyre, Dorian Nkono.

results.title: Samoa I Sisifo
results.creator_credit: Juniper Films, Dan Tristam and Jamie Wilson
results.brief_description: Portrays the interweaving of traditional values and progressive development of the Samoan islanders giving an overall coverage of the people and their lifestyle. Covers also the tourist industry and shows the celebration of Western Samoa’s 10th anniversary of independence.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Juniper Films, Dan Tristam and Jamie Wilson

results.title: Samoa [Widescreen]
results.brief_description: A graphic insight into the lives of the people of Samoa, an idyllic island group in the South Pacific, with a gentle climate, rich soil. Mountain peaks, and abundant water. Describes some f the elaborate ceremonies and customs developed by the Samoans. Shows the collecting and processing of copra, the principle export.

results.title: Samoa
results.creator_credit: New Zealand National Film Unit and Stanhope Andrews
results.brief_description: A survey of native life, customs and cultural activities in Western Samoa. The islanders are seen at work - making baskets, and copra, picking coconuts, bread0frut, and bananas, building a church, and fishing. Glimpses inside hospitals and medical centres illustrate the work being undertaken in safeguarding the health of the native. Recreational activities include Samoa cricket, singing and dancing.

results.title: Sammy and Rosie get laid
results.creator_credit: Sammy and Rosie Ltd, Tim Bevan, Sarah Radclyffe and Stephen Frears
results.brief_description: With relentless momentum director Stephen Frears unfolds the story of Sammy the hedonistic, thoroughly English, son of a prominent Pakistani politician, who abandoned the young man and his mother in London years before to seek wealth and power in his homeland. Sammy, who scrapes out a living as an accountant, lives in a dangerous and decaying black neighbourhood with his wife Rosie, a sexually adventurous “modern woman” supportive of fashionable radical issues. Theirs is an open marriage based on, as Rosie puts it, “freedom plus commitment”. Change enters their lives with the arrival of Rafi, Sammy’s long lost father who has been forced to flee his political enemies in Pakistan. Struggling to maintain his self-dignity and his sanity in the terrifying environment of the city he no longer knows, Rafi rapidly becomes disenchanted by Sammy and Rosie’s unanchored world and tolerance of sexual liberty, drugs and revolutionary violence. As the demons of his past return to haunt Rafi, escape is impossible; personal tragedy is inevitable.

results.title: Sammy's super T-shirt (Captioned)
results.brief_description: When Sammy’s T-shirt is accidentally chemically treated and he becomes super strong, the scene is set for fun, adventure and lots of exciting chases. Rated: G
